results.title: Mr and Mrs Bridge
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant and Cineplex Odeon Films in association with Miramax
results.brief_description: Naive, prudish, yet sweet and endearing, India Bridge (Joanna Woodward) devotes every waking moment to her family. She has no understanding of current affairs because that’s Walter’s (Paul Newman) domain - he knows everything and he’s never wrong. That’s Mr and Mrs. Bridge, or is it? As their children mature and discover boys, girls, sex and silliness, India and Walter suddenly face challenging issues. When Mrs. Bridge decides to show that she is more than a doormat, her new-found independence sparks a heartwarming journey for the whole family - from curious moments, to crisis after amusing crisis. Co-starring Blythe Danner, Simon Callow, Kyra Sedgwick, Robert Sean Leonard, Margaret Welsh, Austin Pendleton and Saundra McClain. Based on the novels “Mr Bridge” and “Mrs Bridge” by Evan S. Connell.

results.title: The Snapper
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Lynda Myles and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Curley’s are a working class Dublin family headed by Dessie, (Colm Meaney), an affable plasterer with a taste for the drink, and Kay, (Ruth McCabe), who keeps their six children in line. This topsy-turvy household falls into a tailspin when 20 year-old Sharon, (Tina Kellegher) announces that she is pregnant. Tensions mount when it becomes obvious that she has no intention of revealing the child’s paternity. As the time approaches for the little “snapper’ to be born, Dessie is becoming a New Age Man while Sharon learns to turn life’s little “accidents’ into big achievements. This is a delightful Irish comedy, well handled by director Frears and with quality performances by Meany and Kellegher.

results.title: Lady Chatterley's lover
results.creator_credit: Just Jaeckin, Andre Djaoui, Christopher Pearce, Cine-Artist GMBH, Producteurs Associes and London Cannon Films
results.brief_description: Based on the famous and scandalous novel by D. H. Lawrence, a classic love story banned for over 30 years when first published. This controversial literary classic is brought to the screen by the director of “Emmanuelle”, and stars Sylvia Kristel as Lady Chatterley; rich, titled and beautiful but increasingly restless and frustrated by her passionless marriage to Sir Clifford (Shane Briant). Increasingly attracted to the handsome Mellors (Nicholas Clay), her husband’s gamekeeper, she is soon seeking physical and emotional satisfaction in a passionate affair, oblivious to the ensuing social scandal. Cast includes Ann Mitchell, Elizabeth Spriggs and Peter Bennett.

results.title: La Ronde = Circle of love
results.creator_credit: Roger Vadim, Raymond Hakim and Robert Hakim
results.brief_description: La Ronde is a romantic drama with an all-star cast lead by Jane Fonda, Jean Sorel and Catherine Spaak. It is set in pre-World War I Paris when the city was caught in a fever pitch of gaiety and affairs of the heart. Based on Arthur Schintzler’s famous stage play “Reigen”, the screenplay is given a fresh viewpoint by applying French psychology to the pursuit of love in its various forms. Dubbed in English.

results.title: The Untouchables
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma, Art Linson, Paramount Pictures and Linson Films
results.brief_description: Al Capone reigned as King in Prohibition Chicago, 1931. A team of determined government investigators, led by a young Federal Treasury agent is committed to bringing Capone to justice. Unbribable and incorruptible, they are “The Untouchables”. Kevin Costner stars as the legendary Eliot Ness in this bold action thriller by famed director Brian De Palma. Along with Costner, Sean Connery gives an award winning performance as tough beat cop Jimmy Malone, while Andy Garcia and Charles Martin Smith are the rest of the team. Robert De Niro is chilling as the sadistic but seductive Al Capone; a man who smiles when he kills.

results.title: The Roaring Twenties
results.creator_credit: Raoul Walsh, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: No other actor played a gangster with the conviction of James Cagney. As Eddie Bartlett, James Cagney epitomises the classic ani-hero - a lawless man in a lawless time. Humphrey Bogart cut his teeth with his rough and tough portrayal of George - Eddie’s closest buddy and partner in crime. The combined talents of these two stars make “The Roaring Twenties” a landmark in cinematic history - the seminal gangster movie. Co-starring Priscilla Lane, Gladys George, Jeffrey Lynn, Frank McHugh and Paul Kelly.

results.title: Sacred hearts
results.creator_credit: Barbara Rennie, Dee Dee Glass and Reality Productions
results.brief_description: The torment, fear and severe discipline of impressionable schoolgirls at a Catholic orphanage in wartime Britain are brought vividly to the screen in “Sacred hearts”. Sister Thomas, (Anna Massey) is a major contributor to the atmosphere of intellectual, sexual and emotional repression at the convent school, where no signs of affection are tolerated. Excellently acted and constructed, this film exposes some of the myths and rituals which make up our perceptions of convent schools. The cast also includes Katrin Carlidge and Oona Kirsh.

results.title: The Late show
results.creator_credit: Robert Benton, Robert Altman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Ira Wells (Art Carney) is an ageing private eye trying to solve the murder of his ex-partner (Howard Duff), “helped” by Margo (Lily Tomlin), a flaky, aimless young woman. The chemistry between Carney and Tomlin is perfect and echoes of Chandler and Hammett resound in Benton’s complex but likeable script. This quietly authoritative show-stopper is a marvellous comment on classics like “The Maltese Falcon” and “The Big Sleep”, while at the same time taking its place beside them as a superior example of the genre. Also starring Bill Macy and Eugene Roche. Co-starring Joanna Cassidy, John Considine, Ruth Nelson, Howard Duff and John Davey.

results.title: Funny lady
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, Ray Stark, Rastar Productions and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Barbra Streisand is the exuberant Fanny Brice, Zeigfield performer extraordinaire in this sequel to the outstanding film “Funny girl”. This lively, lavish musical opens a new chapter in Fanny’s career and love life. Now divorced from the wealthy Nicky (Sharif), she teams up with songwriter Billy Rose (Caan), a brash and unkempt showman who is bursting with enthusiasm and theatrical ambitions. It is a poignant story of their showbusiness magic, unbridled temperaments and passionate romance. Featuring dazzling production numbers, elegant costuming by Bob Mackie and an electric cast, this is an unforgettable.

results.title: King of kings
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Ray, Samuel Bronston and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: In a time of violence and fear came a man of peace, hope, love and forgiveness. The man was Jesus and he changed the world. Panoramic scenes of clamorous battles between Roman legions and Judean rebels contrast with the serene faith of Jesus. From his birth in a Bethlehem manger, Christ’s life is brought to the screen with simplicity and eloquence: his forty day ordeal in the desert, selection of the Apostles, the sermon on the Mount, Judas’s betrayal, the Passion and the Resurrection.
